meanings.definition: The act of closing or shutting something off.
meanings.sent1: The closured of the store happened at midnight.
meanings.sent2: The closured of the gate ensured no one could enter.
meanings.sent3: The closured of the cookie jar left the kids disappointed.
meanings.sent4: The closured of the book marked the end of the story.

meanings.definition: The state of being closed or shut off.
meanings.sent1: The closured of the museum was due to renovations.
meanings.sent2: The closured of the window kept the room dark.
meanings.sent3: The closured of the fridge made finding snacks difficult.
meanings.sent4: The closured of his heart made him distant.
meanings.sent5: The permanent closured of the old factory was sad for the town.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something to an end or conclusion.
meanings.sent1: The closured of the meeting was abrupt.
meanings.sent2: The closured of the project was a relief for the team.
meanings.sent3: The closured of the party left everyone wanting more.
